subject: Names, Organizational
Football
lead_paragraph: The Washington Redskins defended the team’s name in a letter to the Senate majority leader, Harry Reid of Nevada, two days after 50 Democratic senators urged Roger Goodell, the N.F.L.’s commissioner, to support a change.
snippet: The Washington Redskins defended the team’s name in a letter to the Senate majority leader, Harry Reid of Nevada, two days after 50 Democratic senators urged Roger Goodell, the N.F.L.’s commissioner, to support a change.
